metadata.Title: CVE-2022-23990 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Expat (aka libexpat) before 2.4.4 has an integer overflow in the doProlog function.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-23990` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

expat - 2.4.3-3
libexpat1 - 2.4.3-3
No subscription required

firefox - 1:1snap1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> paraview uses system expat xotcl uses system expat poco uses system expat gdcm uses system expat audacity uses system expat simgear uses system expat coin3 uses system expat as of 4.0.0~CMake~6f54f1602475+ds1-1 sitecopy uses system expat since 1:0.16.0-1 (dapper!) rodrigo-zaiden> libxmltok does not include in_eldec in dtd, so, it is not affected.

criterions.comment: cadaver package in kinetic is affected and may need fixing.
expat package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.3-3').
firefox package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:1snap1-0ubuntu1').
insighttoolkit4 package in kinetic is affected and may need fixing.
matanza package in kinetic is affected and may need fixing.
swish-e package in kinetic is affected and may need fixing.
tdom package in kinetic is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in kinetic is affected and may need fixing.
wbxml2 package in kinetic is affected and may need fixing.
xmlrpc-c package in kinetic is affected and may need fixing.
